00020 #ifndef AGG_BSPLINE_INCLUDED
00021 #define AGG_BSPLINE_INCLUDED
00022 
00023 namespace agg
00024 {
00025     //------------------------------------------------------------------------
00026     // A very simple class of Bi-cubic Spline interpolation.
00027     // First call init(num, x[], y[]) where num - number of source points, 
00028     // x, y - arrays of Y and Y values respectively. Here Y must be a function 
00029     // of X. It means that all the X-coordinates must be arranged in the ascending
00030     // order. 
00031     // Then call get(x) that calculates a value Y for the respective X. 
00032     // The class supports extrapolation, i.e. you can call get(x) where x is
00033     // outside the given with init() X-range. Extrapolation is a simple linear 
00034     // function.
00035     //------------------------------------------------------------------------
00036     class bspline 
00037     {
00038     public:
00039         ~bspline();
00040         bspline();
00041 
00042         void   init(int num, double* x, double* y);
00043         double get(double x) const;
00044     
00045     private:
00046         bspline(const bspline&);
00047         const bspline& operator = (const bspline&);
00048 
00049         static void bsearch(int n, double *x, double x0, int *i, int *j);
00050 
00051         int    m_num;
00052         double *m_x;
00053         double *m_y;
00054         double *m_am;
00055     };
00056 
00057 
00058 }
00059 
00060 #endif
